annotation.TEXT: 2-life combo! Unfortunately, Chuck's a lame-o and only gives you 800 points, regardless of your current invincibility combo.
Heck yeah, killin' stuff with my head because my butt's on the ground.
There's the first midpoint of this hack, and what I assume is the exit pipe from that side area.
BGM: SMB3 - Athletic
BGM: New SMB DS - Walking the Plains
Yay, I like it when I can save my progr2.00ss!
There's the first wall triangle of this hack, which you may want to avoid kicking a shell at.
Push!
BGM: Super Mario 64 - Cave Dungeon
Okay, now let me quickly redo the first portion of this first real level...
Ooh, I wonder what kind of kill combo I can get here?
So let's start off with Yoshi's House, like usual.
Uh, oh. I think these platforms are trying to square off against you!
Oh, yeah. Since I'm on a submap, I've got to keep in mind that the moles take longer to pop out of the dirt.
BGM: SMB3 - World 1 Map
Huh, now how would I reach that block? Do I need to come back with Yoshi? ...Nope. There's a hidden block here that I can use.
Wait, why am I wasting time hitting yellow ! blocks when I don't need any mushrooms?
Yep, even much-abused horses need vacations!
And here we have our first burnination power up of this hack.
Be sure to get this easy 1-up... Or don't if you don't care. It's not like lives will be hard to come by...
As you can see, this hack was made by ZMann. Oh, and no one specifically requested that I play this. I decided myself to play through this one.
BGM: SMB3 - Course Clear
And there's the first bubble of this hack, but I think I'd prefer a reserve flower over a reserve mushroom...
And here we have our first Chuck of this hack. Unfortunately for him, he was positioned right near a hole that he can't climb out of. Well, sucks to be him.
And here we have our first ! blocks of this hack, which will eternally isolate this poor Chuck from the rest of civilization... Nuts, that means I can't rampage on him myself!
And there's another turn block that needs to be smacked with a thrown weapon... assuming I can aim right, of course!
Alright, so all there is to the title demo is Bowser doin' his thing, so let's start the game already. You'll notice that I've already been through this hack once before, so this will not be blind.
Hey, why can't I spin jump on this block to break it? It must have something good inside!
It looks like the next level will take place on a bridge, and it will be followed by the first castle of this hack. What awaits me in the rest of the first world of this hack? Find out next time!
Now, honestly, as nice as the SMB3 level clear music is, I think it's kind of on the short side for standard goals. The SMB1 level clear music probably would've been a better choice. Oh, well.
Ooh, this one goes somewhere...
And here we have our first line-guided platforms of this hack. Don't let those elliptical paths mess with your mind... games... mind... games...
And here we have our first Yoshi coin of this hack. Yay.
BGM: Paper Mario - Shy Guy's Toy Box
And, as we all know, I've gotta check every pipe!
Gee, I wonder if I should hit that block with my shell... (One could also opt to use an ice block to hit it as well.)
And here we have... er, had... our first parachuter of this hack. Unfortunately, I kind of shelled him before he could reach the ground...
And here we have our first switch palace of the hack. Hmm... Yeah, sure. I'll play it now.
5-life combo! ...D'oh. If it wasn't for my stupid fireball, I could've probably gotten 7 instead...
And, just like that, I find the first secret exit of this hack!
Ooh, the letter "S"! That's such an awesome letter!
Cool, I knocked that mole's block off with a block! That's a nice way to open the game!
Yep, in case you guys had any doubts, this message box confirms that this is indeed the first switch palace of this hack.
Oh, yeah. I'm not playing [title] anymore, so I've got to remember that I can't wall jump. (I hope there won't be a stupid death because of that later...)
And here we have our first goal point of this hack.
And here we have my first 50-star goal tape hit of this hack! Heck, yeah!
Alright, I'm back here again, and I won't be going down that pipe this time.
BGM: SMB3 - World 8 Map
Huh. The paths almost look like an anchor. Captain Murasa isn't around here, is she? Nah, that Touhou character isn't in this hack.
Oh, so Bowser wants revenge, and that's why he's rampagin'. Alright, well, at least he has a good excuse. Still, Mario's gotta use Take Down on him!
Oh, nuts. I should've tried to bop this guy with the ? block like I did to the very first one in the level, but it slipped my mind this time.
Alright, let's play Verdant Isles 2!
I guess we're going up here.
"Embiggens"? That's a perfectly cromulent word.
Go, my yellow blocks, and start rampagin' across the land with your yellowness!
Alright, let's go to the first real level of this hack, Verdant Isles 1, and get this party started!
Oh, yeah. I'll try to point out the custom music as I go, and I trust you guys will help me fill in any blanks!
To be continued... (There's my first "To be continued..." of this hack...)
BGM: Super Mario All-Stars - Invincibility Star
Ooh, my first fried fish of this hack! I had to cook it myself, but that's not a problem!
And here we have our first invincibility star of this hack! Awesome! Now I get to do my own rampagin'!
Hello, this is SomeGuy712x, and today I'll be starting to play through...
...Bowser Rampages Again! Oh, man! look at him rampagin'!
